battleship.model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • battleship.model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A game board consisting of size * size places where battleships can be placed. A place of the board is denoted by a pair of 1-based indices (x, y), where x is the column index and y is the row index. A place of the board can be shot, resulting in either a hit (ship) or miss. The board recognizes ship sinking and game over, both of which along with the total number of shots can be observed through the BoardChangeListener.
    Author:
    cheon
    See Also:
    Place, Ship

      Provide a no-op implementation for all observer methods.

      To listen to board changes such as hit.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int size)
        Create an empty board of the given dimension that can host the default feet of ships (DEFAULT_SHIPS). The board size must be equal to or bigger than the largest ship size.
        Parameters:
        size - Width and height of the board to be created

      • Board

        public Board(int size,
             java.lang.Iterable<Ship> ships)
        Create an empty board of the given dimension that can host the given fleet of ships. The board size must be at least equal to the largest ship size.
        Parameters:
        size - Width and height of the board to be created
        ships - Battleships to be placed in the board
        See Also:
        Ship

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Remove all the battleships placed on this board. This method should be called before this board is reused for another play.

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(Ship ship,
                         int x,
                         int y,
                         boolean dir)
        Place the given ship at the specified starting position horizontally or vertically. It is assumed the given ship is not already placed.
        Parameters:
        ship - battleship to be placed.
        x - 1-based column index of the starting position
        y - 1-based row index of the starting position
        dir - true for horizontal placement and false for vertical placement.
        Returns:
        true if the ship was placed successfully; false otherwise
        See Also:
        Ship

      • placeShip

        public boolean placeShip(Ship ship,
                         Place place,
                         boolean dir)
        Place the given ship at the specified starting place horizontally or vertically. It is assumed the given ship is not already placed.
        Parameters:
        ship - battleship to be placed.
        place - Starting place.
        dir - true for horizontal placement and false for vertical placement.
        Returns:
        true if the ship was placed successfully; false otherwise
        See Also:
        Ship, Place

        Returns:

      • hit

        public void hit(Place place)
        Record that the given place is hit. This method will call the hit method on the given place if the place is not already marked as hit. If hitting the place means a ship hit, ship sinking, or game over, this method will notify this board change to all registered observers.
        Parameters:
        place - Place to shoot
        See Also:
        Place
